body_html:
I had been stuck in the same issue and found the solution. It seems that the Openjdk JVM wans't able to make some types of http requests. I purged it and installed the Oracle JVM and was able to successfully build tensorflow. I also had to purge the Cuda installation but it was simple to install it back because the files were already in cache.

So, to fix this:

  1. purge Cuda, OpenJDK and Bazel
  2. Install Java JDK from here
  3. Reinstall Bazel, Cuda and CudNN
  4. Run ./configure again at tensorflow folder
  5. Run the bazel build. This time it should work

body:
I had been stuck in the same issue and found the solution. It seems that the Openjdk JVM wans't able to make some types of http requests. I purged it and installed the Oracle JVM and was able to successfully build tensorflow. I also had to purge the Cuda installation but it was simple to install it back because the files were already in cache.

So, to fix this:
1. purge Cuda, OpenJDK and Bazel
2. Install Java JDK from [here](http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jdk9-downloads-3848520.html)
3. Reinstall Bazel, Cuda and CudNN
4. Run `./configure` again at tensorflow folder
5. Run the `bazel build`. This time it should work
